lv.emes.libraries.communication.db

Class MS_JDBCDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.communication.db.MS_JDBCDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MS_IJDBCDatabase
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MS_MySQLDatabase

    public abstract class MS_JDBCDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements MS_IJDBCDatabase
    Implements most common DB connection use cases.

    For successors need to override class method connect(hostname, dbName, port, userName, password) to set up connection conn.

    Method summary: -connect -prepareQuery -getQueryResult -commitStatement -setBLOB -getBLOB

    Version:
    1.3.
    Author:
    eMeS

      Set this to handle this kind of error when trying to execute statement incorrectly and after that trying to access it when trying to get query result or committing statement!
      IFuncOnSQLException onDBStatementError
      Set this to handle this kind of error when trying to execute statement incorrectly or DB access error happens!

                    int port,
                    java.lang.String userName,

             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Connects to given DB.
        Specified by:
        connect in interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Parameters:
        hostname - "localhost", "http://emesserver.ddns.net", "128.156.244.123", etc.
        dbName - if not used, leave null or "", if used - database name.
        port - number of port to DB connection.
        userName - DB user name.
        password - DB password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if JDBC driver failed to load.

      • prepareQuery

        public MS_PreparedStatement prepareQuery(java.lang.String sql)
        Prepares statement for given SQL query. Exception handling is done silently (you don't need to handle those exceptions every time, just set common error handling operations of JDBCDatabase)

        PreparedStatement stmt = prepareQuery(Select * from table where id=?);
        stmt.setInt(1, id);
        ResultSet getQueryResult(stmt);
         OR
        commitQuery(stmt); //if making changes in DB

        Specified by:
        prepareQuery in interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement that may contain one or more '?' IN parameter placeholders
        Returns:
        a new default MS_PreparedStatement object containing the pre-compiled SQL statement
        See Also:
        prepareQueryWithThrows(java.lang.String), MS_IJDBCDatabase.prepareQuery(String)

      • prepareQueryWithThrows

        public MS_PreparedStatement prepareQueryWithThrows(java.lang.String sql)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Just like executeQuery, but if exception occurs, it isn't handled silently, using "onError" methods. So use this method if you want to instantly handle errors using individual approach for some case!
        Specified by:
        prepareQueryWithThrows in interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement that may contain one or more '?' IN parameter placeholders
        Returns:
        a new default MS_PreparedStatement object containing the pre-compiled SQL statement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection
        See Also:
        MS_IJDBCDatabase.prepareQuery(java.lang.String)

      • getQueryResult

        public java.sql.ResultSet getQueryResult(MS_PreparedStatement statement)
        Description copied from interface: MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Gets the result of executed statement. Example of use (executes given statement and prints out first column of result as String):

        ResultSet ress = db.getQueryResult(statement);
        while (ress.next()) {
        System.out.println(ress.getString(1)); //columns are starting with 1
        }

        Specified by:
        getQueryResult in interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Parameters:
        statement - proper SQL statement which have been executed as SELECT type statement.
        Returns:
        ResultSet

      • commitStatement

        public boolean commitStatement(MS_PreparedStatement statement)
        Description copied from interface: MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Commits executed statement.
        Specified by:
        commitStatement in interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
        Parameters:
        statement - a already executed statement to commit.
        Returns:
        true, if success, false - if failed to commit for some reason.

      • setBLOB

        public static void setBLOB(MS_PreparedStatement statement,
                           int paramNumber,
                           java.lang.String filename)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.sql.SQLException
        Loads binary file into statement as parameter.
        Parameters:
        statement - prepared statement.
        paramNumber - number of i-th "?" (starting with 1) which should hold binary object.
        filename - name of the file which will be loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file doesn't exist.
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong with assigning correct param to statement.

      • getBLOB

        public static java.io.InputStream getBLOB(java.sql.ResultSet result,
                                          int paramNumber)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets binary stream as InputStream from database ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        result - ResultSet
        paramNumber - Number of i-th return parameter of select query starting from 1!
        Returns:
        binary stream filled with contents of some column in database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong during stream obtaining

      • getBLOB

        public static void getBLOB(java.sql.ResultSet result,
                           int paramNumber,
                           java.lang.String filename)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Gets binary stream from database ResultSet and saves it to file `filename.
        Parameters:
        result - ResultSet
        paramNumber - Number of i-th return parameter of select query starting from 1!
        filename - name of external file that will be created
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong during stream obtaining
        java.io.IOException - if cannot convert streams
